description: This ruleset detects embedded framework libraries that may cause issues during migration.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="embedded-framework-libraries-01000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <graph-query discriminator="JarArchiveModel">
                    <property name="fileName" searchType="regex">.*drools.*\.jar$</property>
                </graph-query>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <classification category-id="optional" effort="0" title="Embedded library - Drools">
                    <description>
                        The application embedds a Drools library.
                    </description>
                </classification>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Drools (embedded)</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="embedded-framework-libraries-02000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <graph-query discriminator="JarArchiveModel">
                    <property name="fileName" searchType="regex">.*hibernate.*\.jar$</property>
                </graph-query>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <classification category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Hibernate embedded library">
                    <description>
                        The application has a Hibernate library embedded.
                        Red Hat JBoss EAP includes Hibernate as a module with a version that has been tested and supported by Red Hat.
                        There are two options for using the Hibernate library:

                        1. Keep it embedded as it is now. This approach is low effort but the application will not use a tested and supported library.
                        2. Switch to use the Hibernate library in the EAP module. This will require effort to remove the embedded library and configure the application to use the module's library but then the application will rely on a tested and supported version of the Hibernate library.

                        In the links below there are the instructions to enable alternative versions for both EAP 6 and 7.
                    </description>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/articles/112673" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP: Component Details"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/#sect-Hibernate_and_JPA_Changes" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP 6: Hibernate and JPA Migration Changes"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/7.0/html/migration_guide/application_migration_changes#hibernate_and_jpa_migration_changes" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP 7: Hibernate and JPA Migration Changes"/>
                </classification>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Hibernate (embedded)</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="embedded-framework-libraries-04000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <graph-query discriminator="JarArchiveModel">
                    <property name="fileName" searchType="regex">.*jdbc.*\.jar$</property>
                </graph-query>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <classification category-id="optional" effort="0" title="Embedded library - JDBC">
                    <description>
                        The application embeds a JDBC library.
                    </description>
                </classification>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">JDBC (embedded)</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="embedded-framework-libraries-05000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <graph-query discriminator="JarArchiveModel">
                        <property name="fileName" searchType="regex">.*jsf-[(api)|(impl)].*\.jar$</property>
                    </graph-query>
                    <graph-query discriminator="JarArchiveModel">
                        <property name="fileName" searchType="regex">.*myfaces-[(api)|(impl)|(bundle)].*\.jar$</property>
                    </graph-query>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <classification category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="JSF embedded library">
                    <description>
                        The application has a JSF library embedded.

                        Red Hat JBoss EAP includes JSF as a module with a version that has been tested and is supported by Red Hat.
                        There are two options for using the JSF library:

                        1. Keep it embedded as it is now. This approach is low effort but the application will not use a tested and supported library.
                        2. Switch to use the JSF library in the EAP module. This will require effort to remove the embedded library and configure the application to use the module's library, but then the application will rely on a tested and supported version of the JSF library.

                        In the links below there are instructions to enable alternative versions for both EAP 6 and 7.
                    </description>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/articles/112673" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP: Component Details"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/#sect-JSF_changes" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP 6: JavaServer Faces (JSF) Code Changes"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/solutions/690953" title="How to use JSF 1.2 with EAP 6"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/7.0/html/migration_guide/application_migration_changes#migrate_jsf_code_changes" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP 7: JavaServer Faces (JSF) Code Changes"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/solutions/2773121" title="How to use JSF 1.2 with EAP 7?"/>
                </classification>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">JSF (embedded)</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="embedded-framework-libraries-06000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <graph-query discriminator="JarArchiveModel">
                    <property name="fileName" searchType="regex">jboss-seam.*\.jar$</property>
                </graph-query>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <classification category-id="mandatory" effort="5" title="Seam 2 embedded library">
                    <description>
                        The application has a Seam library embedded.

                        While official support for Seam 2.2 applications was dropped in JBoss EAP 6, it was still possible to configure dependencies for JSF 1.2 and Hibernate 3 to allow Seam 2.2 applications to run on that release.

                        Seam 2.3 should work on JBoss EAP 6 even some framework features and integrations from Seam 2.2 are not supported.

                        Red Hat JBoss EAP 7, which now includes JSF 2.2 and Hibernate 5, does not support Seam 2.2 or Seam 2.3 due to end of life of Red Hat JBoss Web Framework Kit. It is recommended that you rewrite your Seam components using CDI beans.
                        In the links below there are the instructions to enable alternatives for both EAP 6 and 7
                    </description>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/index#sect-Migrate_Seam_2.2_Applications" title="EAP 6 - Migrate Seam 2.2 applications"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_JBoss_Web_Framework_Kit/2.7/html-single/Seam_Guide/index.html#migration23" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP 6: Migration from 2.2 to 2.3"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_JBoss_Web_Framework_Kit/2.7/html-single/Seam_Guide/index.html#idm54350960" title="Red Hat JBoss EAP: Migration from Seam 2 to Java EE and alternatives"/>
                    <link href="https://access.redhat.com/solutions/2773121" title="How to use JSF 1.2 with EAP 7?"/>
                </classification>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Seam (embedded)</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>

description: This ruleset detects embedded cache libraries that may cause issues during migration.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="embedded-cache-libraries-01000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <graph-query discriminator="JarArchiveModel">
                    <property name="fileName" searchType="regex">.*ehcache.*\.jar$</property>
                </graph-query>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <classification category-id="cloud-mandatory" effort="5" title="Caching - Ehcache embedded library">
                    <description>
                        The application embeds an Ehcache library.

                        Cloud readiness issue as potential state information that is not persisted to a backing service.
                    </description>
                </classification>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Ehcache (embedded)</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>

addRule()
	.when(JavaClass.references(javax.persistence.Entity).at([ANNOTATION])

		.references(javax.persistence.DiscriminatorValue).at([ANNOTATION])

)

description:
This ruleset provides analysis that may require individual attention when
         migrating from Sonic classes.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="sonic-catchall-00000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.{subpackage}.{classname}"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <iteration>
                    <when>
                        <not>
                            <has-hint/>
                        </not>
                    </when>
                    <perform>
                        <hint category-id="potential" effort="0" title="Sonic proprietary type reference com.{subpackage}.{classname}">
                            <message>
                                This com.{subpackage}.{classname} is a Sonic proprietary type and needs to be migrated to a compatible API. There are currently no detailed
                                migration rules about this type.
                            </message>
                            <tag>sonic</tag>
                            <tag>catchall</tag>
                        </hint>
                    </perform>
                </iteration>
            </perform>
            <where param="subpackage">
                <matches pattern="(sonic|sonicsw)(\..*)?"/>
            </where>
            <where param="classname">
                <matches pattern="[^.]+"/>
            </where>
        </rule>

description: This rule set identifies Sonic ESB XML configuration files.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="xml-sonic-esb-01000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <xmlfile matches="/*[local-name()='serviceType']">
                    <namespace prefix="xq" uri="http://www.sonicsw.com/sonicxq"/>
                </xmlfile>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <classification effort="4" issue-display-mode="detail-only" title="SonicESB Service Configuration">
                    <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                </classification>
            </perform>
        </rule>

description: This ruleset contains rules that assist in migrating from Sonic ESB to Apache Camel.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="sonic-esb-01000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQService">
                    <location>INHERITANCE</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <classification effort="0" issue-display-mode="detail-only" title="Sonic ESB Service">
                     <link href="http://documentation.progress.com/output/Sonic/8.0.0/Docs8.0/api/esb_api/com/sonicsw/xq/XQService.html" title="XQService Javadoc"/>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                 </classification>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="4" title="Sonic ESB service - inheritance from com.sonicsw.xq.XQService">
                     <message>
                       <![CDATA[
                       Sonic ESB services inherit from XQService.  In Camel, this can be achieved through the simple Java Bean Camel Component.

                       * [Camel Java Bean Component](http://camel.apache.org/bean.html)
                       ]]>
                     </message>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-02000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQServiceContext">
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="4" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQServiceContext">
                     <message>
                       <![CDATA[
                       Sonic ESB services leverage the service(XQServiceContext context) method to implement business logic.  When messages are routed to the service, the service(XQServiceContext context) method is executed.
                       In Camel, this is achieved by routing messages to the Java Bean via the Camel Route's Bean Component syntax.

                       * [Camel Java Bean Component](http://camel.apache.org/bean.html)
                       * [Camel Binding Annotations](http://camel.apache.org/parameter-binding-annotations.html)

                       Camel's Java Bean Component can leverage annotations annotations on the method to specify how Camel Message body values are mapped to the method parameters.  Additionally, the @Handler annotation can be leveraged to setup the default Java Bean method.

                       **For example:**

                       ```java
                       public void service(XQServiceContext ctx) throws XQServiceException \{
                       ...
                       }
                       ```

                       **Should become:**

                       ```java
                       @Handler
                       public void service(@Header messageHeader, @Body messageBody, Exchange exchange) \{
                       ...
                       }
                       ```

                       * org.apache.camel.Body
                       * org.apache.camel.Header
                       * org.apache.camel.Exchange
                       ]]>
                     </message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-03000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQInitContext">
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="4" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQInitContext">
                     <message>
                       <![CDATA[
                       The XQInitContext is used to receive initialization information for the service from Sonic ESB.

                       This is not neccessary for Camel.  The init() method that receives this object should be replaced with Spring Bean property injection.  For initialization beyond propery injection, leverage Spring's @PostConstruct annotation on this init() method.

                       * [Spring @PostConstruct Documentation](http://docs.spring.io/spring/docs/2.5.x/reference/beans.html#beans-postconstruct-and-predestroy-annotations)

                       ```java
                       @PostConstruct
                       public void init() \{
                       //leverage injected properties
                       }
                       ```
                       ]]>
                     </message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>spring</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-04000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQInitContext.getParameters{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQInitContext.getParameters">
                     <message>Migrate XQInitContext.getParameters to Spring property injection.</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-05000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQParameters.getParameter{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQParameters.getParameter">
                     <message>Migrate XQParameters.getParameter to Spring property injection.</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>spring</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-06000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQParameters">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQParameters">
                     <message>Migrate XQParameters to Spring property injection.</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>spring</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-07000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQParameterInfo">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQParameters">
                     <message>Migrate XQParameterInfo to Spring property injection.</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>spring</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-08000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage">
                     <message>Migrate to org.apache.camel.Message</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-09000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getHeaderValue{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getHeaderValue">
                     <message>Migrate to org.apache.camel.Message.getHeader(String name)</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-10000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.setHeaderValue{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.setHeaderValue">
                     <message>Migrate to org.apache.camel.Message.setHeader(String name, Object value)</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-11000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getHeaderNames{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getHeaderNames">
                     <message>Migrate to org.apache.camel.Message.getHeaders()</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-12000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQPart">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQPart">
                     <message>Migrate XQPart to an attachment on the org.apache.camel.Message</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-13000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getPartCount{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getPartCount">
                     <message>Migrate to org.apache.camel.Message.getAttachments().size()</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-14000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getPart({*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getPart">
                     <message>Migrate to org.apache.camel.Message.getAttachment(String id)</message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-15000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQLog">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQLog">
                     <message><![CDATA[
                        Migrate to [Apache SLF4J](http://www.slf4j.org).
                     ]]></message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>slf4j</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-16000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQServiceException">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQServiceException ">
                     <message>
                       <![CDATA[
                       Create a custom ServiceException class, extending Exception.  The documentation below explains exception handling in Camel.

                       * [Camel Exception Handling](http://camel.apache.org/exception-clause.html)
                       ]]>
                     </message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-17000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getCorrelationId{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQMessage.getCorrelationId">
                     <message>
                       <![CDATA[
                       Correlation is handled several ways in Camel.  Read the article below.

                       * [Camel Exception Handling](http://camel.apache.org/correlation-identifier.html)
                       ]]></message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-18000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQAddressFactory.createEndpointAddress{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQAddressFactory.createEndpointAddress">
                     <message>
                       <![CDATA[
                       This indicates that the Sonic ESB Service is routing messages to a [1...N] endpoints.  To achieve this in Camel, take the business logic in the service, and populate a header property with an array of target enpoints.

                       Next, create a Recipient List processor to route the message to N endpoints.

                       * [Camel Recipient List](http://camel.apache.org/recipientlist-annotation.html)
                       ]]>
                     </message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-19000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQServiceContext.addOutgoing{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQServiceContext.addOutgoing">
                     <message>
                       <![CDATA[
                       Sonic ESB uses the addOutgoing method to set the outgoing message.
                       This is achieved in Camel by either modifying the @Body parameter in the Java Bean Component method, or literally setting a new message to the Exchange.

                       * [Camel Setting Response](http://camel.apache.org/using-getin-or-getout-methods-on-exchange.html)
                       ]]>
                     </message>
                     <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                     <tag>camel</tag>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-20000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQEnvelope">
                    <location>TYPE</location>
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
               <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="3" title="Reference to com.sonicsw.xq.XQEnvelope">
                  <message>Migrate to org.apache.camel.Exchange</message>
                  <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                  <tag>camel</tag>
               </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="sonic-esb-21000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="com.sonicsw.xq.XQEnvelope.getMessage{*}">
                    <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
               <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Call of com.sonicsw.xq.XQEnvelope.getMessage">
                  <message>Migrate to org.apache.camel.Message.getIn()</message>
                  <tag>sonic-esb</tag>
                  <tag>camel</tag>
               </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

description: This ruleset provides analysis that may require individual attention when migrating to newer Hibernate java constructs.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="hibernate-catchall-00000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="org.hibernate.{package-remainder}.{type}"/>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <iteration>
               <when>
                  <not>
                     <has-hint/>
                  </not>
               </when>
               <perform>
                  <classification category-id="optional" effort="0" issue-display-mode="all" title="Hibernate">
                     <description>This is a Hibernate type and it will need to be verified for compatibility with the latest Hibernate version.</description>
                     <tag>catchall</tag>
                  </classification>
               </perform>
            </iteration>
         </perform>
         <where param="package-remainder">
            <matches pattern="(.*)?"/>
         </where>
         <where param="type">
            <matches pattern="[^.]+"/>
         </where>
      </rule>

description: This ruleset provides analysis of Hibernate older version xml configuration files and their migration to newer one.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="hibernate-xml-01000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <xmlfile as="1" matches="/hibernate-mapping"/>
                <xmlfile as="2" from="1" matches="//*[@type='string']"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <iteration over="2">
                    <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Hibernate: Deprecated 'string' CLOB data type">
                        <message>In versions of Hibernate prior to 3.5, text type was mapped to JDBC CLOB. A new Hibernate type, `materialized_clob`, was added in Hibernate 4 to map Java `String` properties to JDBC CLOB</message>
                        <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/index#Migrate_Your_Hibernate_3.5.x_Application_to_Hibernate_4.x" title="Hibernate 3 to 4 - JDBC CLOB migration"/>
                        <tag>hibernate</tag>
                        <tag>configuration</tag>
                    </hint>
                </iteration>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-xml-02000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
               <xmlfile as="1" matches="/hibernate-configuration"/>
               <xmlfile as="2" from="1" matches="//property[@name='hibernate.jdbc.use_streams_for_binary']"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <iteration over="2">
                    <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="hibernate.jdbc.use_streams_for_binary must be set according to the provider">
                         <message><![CDATA[
                        If you are using Oracle and using the ```materialized_clob``` or ```materialized_blob``` properties, this global environment variable must be set to true.
			If you are using PostgreSQL and using the CLOB or BLOB properties, this global environment variable  must be set to false.
                    ]]></message>
                        <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/index#Migrate_Your_Hibernate_3.5.x_Application_to_Hibernate_4.x" title="Hibernate 3.5 to 4 - properties"/>
                        <tag>hibernate</tag>
                        <tag>configuration</tag>
                    </hint>
                </iteration>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-xml-03000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
               <filecontent filename="hibernate-configuration.xml" pattern="org.hibernate.connection"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Hibernate: Removed package org.hibernate.connection">
                     <message>From Hibernate 4.0 there were moved classes from package `org.hibernate.connection` to package `org.hibernate.service.jdbc.connections.internal`.
                     You should change your Hibernate setup to replace references to the old package names.
                     </message>
                     <tag>hibernate</tag>
                     <tag>configuration</tag>
                     <quickfix name="hibernate-connection" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.hibernate.service.jdbc.connections.internal.</replacement>
                        <search>org.hibernate.connection.</search>
                     </quickfix>
                 </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-xml-04000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <xmlfile system-id="http://hibernate.sourceforge.net/hibernate-configuration-3.0.dtd"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <classification category-id="mandatory" effort="1" issue-display-mode="all" title="Hibernate: Deprecated dtd configuration namespace">
                    <description> Hibernate 4.0 uses http://www.hibernate.org/dtd/hibernate-configuration-3.0.dtd instead.
                     </description>
                     <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/index#Migrate_Your_Hibernate_3.5.x_Application_to_Hibernate_4.x" title="Hibernate 3.5 to 4 - DTD"/>
                     <tag>hibernate</tag>
                     <tag>configuration</tag>
                 </classification>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-xml-05000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <xmlfile system-id="http://hibernate.sourceforge.net/hibernate-mapping-3.0.dtd"/>
            </when>
            <perform>
                 <classification category-id="mandatory" effort="1" issue-display-mode="all" title="Hibernate: Deprecated dtd mapping namespace">
                    <description> Hibernate 4.0 uses http://www.hibernate.org/dtd/hibernate-mapping-3.0.dtd instead.
                     </description>
                     <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/index#Migrate_Your_Hibernate_3.5.x_Application_to_Hibernate_4.x" title="Hibernate 3.5 to 4 - DTD"/>
                     <tag>hibernate</tag>
                     <tag>configuration</tag>
                 </classification>
            </perform>
        </rule>

description: This ruleset provides analysis of deprecated Hibernate java constructs and their migration to newer one.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="hibernate-01000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass matchesSource="{*}text{*}" references="org.hibernate.annotations.Type"/>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Deprecated @Type(type=text)">
               <message>
                         In versions of Hibernate prior to 3.5, text type was mapped to JDBC CLOB. A new Hibernate type, materialized_clob, was added in Hibernate 4 to map Java String properties to JDBC CLOB. Therefore, Hibernate 4 text LOB type definitions should be defined using `@Lob`, instead.
                     </message>
               <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/index#Migrate_Your_Hibernate_33x_Application_to_Hibernate_4x" title="Hibernate 4 java @Type migration."/>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-02000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="org.hibernate.criterion.Projections.{method}{*}">
               <location>METHOD_CALL</location>
            </javaclass>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Changed 'Projections' return types">
               <message>
                         The return types of the numeric aggregate criteria projections has changed to Long in hibernate 4. This change may introduce conflicts in the code.
                     </message>
               <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/index#Migrate_Your_Hibernate_33x_Application_to_Hibernate_4x" title="Hibernate 4 projections return type change."/>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
         <where param="method">
            <matches pattern="(count|rowCount|sum)"/>
         </where>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-03000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="org.hibernate.cfg.AnnotationConfiguration{*}">
               <location>CONSTRUCTOR_CALL</location>
            </javaclass>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Changed naming strategy from 'DefaultNamingStrategy' to 'EJB3NamingStrategy'">
               <message>
                         The initial/default naming strategy in Hibernate 4 was changed from DefaultNamingStrategy to EJB3NamingStrategy. This can result in naming mismatches. If you rely on the naming strategy, call Configuration#setNamingStrategy.
                     </message>
               <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/index#Migrate_Your_Hibernate_3.5.x_Application_to_Hibernate_4.x" title="Hibernate 4 naming strategy change documentation."/>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-04000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="org.hibernate.classic.{*}"/>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Removed classes in 'org.hibernate.classic'">
               <message>The deprecated classes in org.hibernate.classic package was removed in Hibernate 4.</message>
               <link href="https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_jboss_enterprise_application_platform/6.4/html-single/migration_guide/#sect-Hibernate_and_JPA_Changes" title="JBoss EAP - Migration Guide: Hibernate and JPA Changes"/>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-05000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="org.hibernate.dialect.resolver.DialectResolver"/>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Replaced DialectResolver">
               <message>Replace org.hibernate.dialect.resolver.DialectResolver with org.hibernate.service.jdbc.dialect.spi.DialectResolver.</message>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-06000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <or>
               <javaclass references="org.hibernate.jdbc.BatcherFactory"/>
               <javaclass references="org.hibernate.jdbc.BatchingBatcherFactory"/>
               <javaclass references="org.hibernate.jdbc.NonBatchingBatcherFactory"/>
            </or>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Replaced BatcherFactory">
               <message>Replace org.hibernate.jdbc.BatcherFactory by org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.batch.spi.BatchBuilder.
                  Their default implementations are in org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.batch.internal.
                  You can override the default BatchBuilder by defining the  "hibernate.jdbc.batch.builder" property as the name of a BatchBuilder implementation
                   or by providing a BatchBuilder in a custom ServiceRegistry.
                  </message>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-07000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <or>
               <javaclass references="org.hibernate.jdbc.Batcher"/>
               <javaclass references="org.hibernate.jdbc.AbstractBatcher"/>
               <javaclass references="org.hibernate.jdbc.BatchingBatcher"/>
               <javaclass references="org.hibernate.jdbc.NonBatchingBatcher"/>
            </or>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Replaced JDBC Batcher">
               <message>Replace org.hibernate.jdbc.Batcher by org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.batch.spi.Batch.
                  Their default implementations are in org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.batch.internal.
                  </message>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-08000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="org.hibernate.engine.SessionImplementor"/>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - SessionImplementor replacement">
               <message>Replace org.hibernate.engine.SessionImplementor with org.hibernate.engine.spi.SessionImplementor
               </message>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-09000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="org.hibernate.connection.{classname}"/>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Renamed package 'org.hibernate.connection'">
               <message>The classes in org.hibernate.connection package was moved to org.hibernate.service.jdbc.connections.internal in Hibernate 4</message>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
         <where param="classname">
            <matches pattern="[^.]+"/>
         </where>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-10000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="org.hibernate.collection.PersistentBag"/>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate 4 - Replace org.hibernate.collection.PersistentBag">
               <message>The class org.hibernate.collection.PersistentBag was moved to org.hibernate.collection.internal.PersistentBag in Hibernate 4</message>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
      </rule>

<rule id="hibernate-10100" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
         <when>
            <javaclass references="net.sf.hibernate.{classname}"/>
         </when>
         <perform>
            <classification category-id="optional" issue-display-mode="detail-only" title="Hibernate 2.x - Renamed package 'net.sf.hibernate'"/>
            <hint category-id="optional" effort="1" title="Hibernate type reference net.sf.hibernate.{classname}">
               <message>
                  This is an old Hibernate package name from version 2.x and needs to be migrated to a compatible API to Hibernate 4.x/5.x,
                  where package name is org.hibernate.
               </message>
               <link href="https://developer.jboss.org/wiki/Hibernate3MigrationGuides" title="Hibernate Migration Guides"/>
               <tag>hibernate</tag>
            </hint>
         </perform>
         <where param="classname">
            <matches pattern="[^.]+"/>
         </where>
      </rule>

description: This is a simple ruleset for detecting usage of clustering technologies.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="clustering-00000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
              <xmlfile matches="/w:web-app/w:distributable">
                  <namespace prefix="w" uri="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/javaee"/>
              </xmlfile>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Clustering Web Session</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="clustering-00001" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <javaclass references="org.jboss.ejb3.annotation.Clustered">
                        <location>ANNOTATION</location>
                        <location>IMPORT</location>
                    </javaclass>
                    <xmlfile matches="/*[local-name()='ejb-jar']/*[local-name()='assembly-descriptor']/*[local-name()='clustering']/*[local-name()='clustered']"/>
                    <xmlfile matches="/*[local-name()='jboss']/*[local-name()='enterprise-beans']/*[local-name()='session']/*[local-name()='clustered']"/>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Clustering EJB</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>

description: This ruleset provides analysis of 3rd party embedded frameworks.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="integration-00001" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">

            <where param="pattern">

description: This rule set configures the organization matching functionality, using known root-package prefixes to identify libraries and other code.

description:
This ruleset provides help for migrating to a unified KIE (Knowledge Is Everything) API in the
             upgrade from version 5 to 6.

rules.ruleContents:
<rule id="kie-api-01000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="org.drools.KnowledgeBase">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.KnowledgeBase is deprecated">
                    <message>Replace with : org.kie.api.KieBase</message>
                    <quickfix name="knowledgebase" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.kie.api.KieBase</replacement>
                        <search>org.drools.KnowledgeBase</search>
                    </quickfix>
                </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="kie-api-01001" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>

                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.event.AgendaEventListener is deprecated">

                        <search>org.drools.event.AgendaEventListener</search>

            </perform>

            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="kie-api-01010" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="org.drools.runtime.StatelessKnowledgeSession">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.runtime.StatelessKnowledgeSession is deprecated">
                    <message>Replace with : org.kie.api.runtime.KieSession</message>
                    <quickfix name="StatelessKnowledgeSession-qf" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.kie.api.runtime.KieSession</replacement>
                        <search>org.drools.runtime.StatelessKnowledgeSession</search>
                    </quickfix>
                </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="kie-api-01011" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="org.drools.builder.KnowledgeBuilderFactory">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.builder.KnowledgeBuilderFactory is deprecated">
                    <message>Replace with : org.kie.internal.builder.KnowledgeBuilderFactory</message>
                    <quickfix name="KnowledgeBuilderFactory-qf" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.kie.internal.builder.KnowledgeBuilderFactory</replacement>
                        <search>org.drools.builder.KnowledgeBuilderFactory</search>
                    </quickfix>
                </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="kie-api-01012" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="org.drools.io.ResourceFactory">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.io.ResourceFactory is deprecated">
                    <message>Replace with : org.kie.internal.io.ResourceFactory</message>
                    <quickfix name="ResourceFactory-qf" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.kie.internal.io.ResourceFactory</replacement>
                        <search>org.drools.io.ResourceFactory </search>
                    </quickfix>
                </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="kie-api-01013" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="org.drools.io.ResourceType">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.io.ResourceType is deprecated">
                    <message>Replace with : org.kie.internal.io.ResourceType</message>
                    <quickfix name="ResourceType-qf" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.kie.internal.io.ResourceType</replacement>
                        <search>org.drools.io.ResourceType</search>
                    </quickfix>
                </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="kie-api-01014" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="org.drools.runtime.Environment">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.runtime.Environment is deprecated">
                    <message>Replace with : org.kie.api.runtime.Environment</message>
                    <quickfix name="Environment-qf" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.kie.api.runtime.Environment</replacement>
                        <search>org.drools.runtime.Environment</search>
                    </quickfix>
                </hint>
            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="kie-api-01015" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="org.drools.runtime.EnvironmentName">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.runtime.EnvironmentName is deprecated">
                    <message>Replace with : org.kie.api.runtime.EnvironmentName</message>
                    <quickfix name="EnvironmentName-qf" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.kie.api.runtime.EnvironmentName</replacement>
                        <search>org.drools.runtime.EnvironmentName</search>
                    </quickfix>

            </perform>
        </rule>

<rule id="kie-api-01016" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <javaclass references="org.drools.runtime.KnowledgeSessionConfiguration">
                    <location>IMPORT</location>
                </javaclass>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint effort="0" title="org.drools.runtime.KnowledgeSessionConfiguration is deprecated">
                    <message>Replace with : org.kie.api.runtime.KieSessionConfiguration</message>
                    <quickfix name="KnowledgeSessionConfiguration-qf" type="REPLACE">
                        <replacement>org.kie.api.runtime.KieSessionConfiguration</replacement>
                        <search>org.drools.runtime.KnowledgeSessionConfiguration</search>
